name: Whatsapp Business Cloud modules
title: Whatsapp Business Cloud modules

children.text: After connecting to the Whatsapp Business Cloud app, you can use the following modules to build your
You can watch events and send messages using the following modules.
Triggers when a new message is received.
Enter a name for the webhook.

data.label: WhatsApp Business Cloud
data.overridedLabel: Connect WhatsApp Business Cloud and Make

children.text: Select the event types you want to receive. If you leave the list unchecked, you will receive all events.
You can send a message using this module under the following conditions:
You can only initiate new chats via
module. Only after sending a templated message to a specific customer and receiving a response from the customer, you can use this
module to send a non-templated message to the customer.
If a customer contacts you first, then you can reply to the customer with this

If you try sending a message while not meeting these conditions the module operation result will appear as success but the message will not reach the customer. Learn about these limitations in WhatsApp's documentation.

data.label: WhatsApp Business Cloud
data.overridedLabel: Connect WhatsApp Business Cloud and Make

children.text: Select or map the Sender ID from which you want to send the message.
Enter the receiver's WhatsApp ID or phone number.
If you are using a testing number:
Enter the receiver's phone number without any prefixes such as
. For example, if the receiver phone number is
, then you must enter it as

If you are using your own phone number, the receiver field accepts both WhatsApp ID and a phone number in any dilable format with country code. However, Make recommends explicitly prefixing the country code with a plus sign (+). Some of the examples of supported phone number formats are:
Select the message type. For example,
Based on the selection, dynamic fields auto-populate, and you need to enter the details to send the message. For more details on these dynamic fields, see
WhatsApp Business Cloud Messages API documentation
For any errors, while sending the messages, see the
Your business phone number must be first approved by WhatsApp before you use it for sending messages.

data.label: WhatsApp Business Cloud
data.overridedLabel: Connect WhatsApp Business Cloud and Make

children.text: Select or map the Sender ID from which you want to send the template message.
Enter the receiver's WhatsApp ID or phone number in any dialable format.
If you are using a testing number:
You must register the recipient's number in the Facebook Developer console.
Enter the receiver's phone number without any prefixes such as
. For example, if the receiver phone number is
, then you must enter it as

If you are using your own phone number, the receiver field accepts both WhatsApp ID and a phone number in any dilable format with country code. However, Make recommends explicitly prefixing the country code with a plus sign (+). Some of the examples of supported phone number formats are:
Select or map the message template you want to send.
You can upload and download media using the following modules.
Uploads a media and retrieves its ID.

data.label: WhatsApp Business Cloud
data.overridedLabel: Connect WhatsApp Business Cloud and Make

children.text: Select or map the ID of a sender whose media you want to upload.
File name - Enter the filename including the file extension. For example,
Data - Enter the path to the file stored in your local directory. For example, "@/local/path/file.jpg".
For more information on supported media types, see the
Downloads a media by its ID.

data.label: WhatsApp Business Cloud
data.overridedLabel: Connect WhatsApp Business Cloud and Make

children.text: Enter the Media ID you want to download.
You can enable two-step verification, register, verify, and deregister senders using the following modules.
Activates the two-step verification for a sender number by its ID and a 6-digit pin.

data.label: WhatsApp Business Cloud
data.overridedLabel: Connect WhatsApp Business Cloud and Make

children.text: Select or map a Sender ID whose two-step verification you want to enable.
Enter (map) a 6-digit pin you wish to use for two-step authentication. To disable or reset two-step verification, see the
Registers a sender by its ID and a 6-digit pin.

data.label: WhatsApp Business Cloud
data.overridedLabel: Connect WhatsApp Business Cloud and Make

children.text: Select or map a Sender ID whom you want to register.
Enter (map) a 6-digit pin you wish to use for registration. To disable or reset two-step verification, see the
Verifies a sender by its ID.

data.label: WhatsApp Business Cloud
data.overridedLabel: Connect WhatsApp Business Cloud and Make

children.text: Select or map a Sender ID whom you want to verify.
Select the action you want to perform to verify the sender:
Select a method for receiving the code:
Enter (map) the code received to complete the verification.
Deregisters a sender by its ID.

data.label: WhatsApp Business Cloud
data.overridedLabel: Connect WhatsApp Business Cloud and Make

children.text: Select or map a Sender ID of a sender to deregister.
You can retrieve and update business profiles using the following modules.
Retrieves the details of the WhatsApp business profile by the sender ID.

data.label: WhatsApp Business Cloud
data.overridedLabel: Connect WhatsApp Business Cloud and Make

children.text: Select or map the Sender ID whose business profile you want to retrieve.
Updates a WhatsApp business profile by the sender ID.

data.label: WhatsApp Business Cloud
data.overridedLabel: Connect WhatsApp Business Cloud and Make

children.text: Select or map the Sender ID whose business profile you want to update.
Enter the address of the business.
Select or map the industry of the business. For example,
Enter the contact email address of the business.
Add the business website URL address.
For example, a website, Facebook Page, or Instagram. You must include the
- Enter the file name of the profile picture.
- Enter the path to the file stored in your local directory. For example,

customCSS:
<style>
@media print {
  html, body {
    overflow-x: visible;
  }
}
#tally-widget-button {
  position: fixed !important;
  background-color: #FFFFFF;
  display: none;
  visibility: visible !important;
  opacity: 1 !important;
  color: #0C121D;
  border: 2px solid #0C121D;
  border-radius: 4px;
  align-items: center;
  justify-content: center;
  font-size: 14px;
  font-weight: 600;
  font-family: 'Inter';
  text-align: center;
  box-shadow: 0 4px 6px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2);
  cursor: pointer;
  z-index: 999999 !important;
  -webkit-tap-highlight-color: transparent;
  outline: none;
  touch-action: manipulation;
  pointer-events: auto;
  transform: translate3d(0, 0, 0);
}
.button-text {
  display: inline-block;
  margin-right: 8px;
}
.button-text::before {
  content: attr(data-text);
}
#tally-widget-popup {
  position: fixed;
  background-color: white;
  display: none;
  border-radius: 12px;
  box-shadow: 0 10px 20px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.4);
  z-index: 999999;
  overflow: hidden;
  border: 0px solid #0C121D;
  padding-top: 30px;
}
#tally-widget-close {
  position: absolute;
  top: 10px;
  right: 10px;
  background: none;
  border: none;
  font-size: 36px;
  font-weight: bold;
  padding: 8px;
  cursor: pointer;
  color: #0C121D;
}

  .ab-plugin-wrapper .ab-link-block-item .ab-link {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
    font-family: 'Inter' !important;
  }

  .dark .ab-plugin-wrapper .ab-link-block-item .ab-link {
    color: #F6F6F6 !important;
  }
  
  #main-column > div > div > div.flex.flex-1.w-full.justify-center.pb-0 > div > div.flex.items-center.pl-0.pr-2.mb-5.xl\:-mt-1\.5 > div > div > div > div:nth-child(1) > div.flex.pr-2.text-gray-500.items-center {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  a.ab-tree-navigation-link-active span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  .ab-public-space-links-wrap .ab-public-space-link:first-of-type {
    border-color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  .ab-toc-item-active a{
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  #main-column .text-ab-blue-500 span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  
  #main-column .text-ab-blue-500 {
    text-decoration-color: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  .ab-nav-left:hover > svg,
  .ab-nav-left:hover .text-gray-300,
  .ab-nav-left:hover .ab-nav-left-text {
     color: #7302D5 !important;
     stroke: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  .ab-nav-right:hover > svg,
  .ab-nav-right:hover .text-gray-300,
  .ab-nav-right:hover .ab-nav-right-text {
     color: #7302D5 !important;
     stroke: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  
#tally-inline-popup {
  position: fixed;
  display: none;
  z-index: 999999;
  width: min(420px, 90vw);
  height: min(550px, 80vh);
  background: #fff;
  color: #0c121d;
  border: 1px solid rgba(0,0,0,0.08);
  border-radius: 12px;
  box-shadow: 0 12px 28px rgba(0,0,0,0.22), 0 2px 6px rgba(0,0,0,0.12);
  overflow: hidden;
  padding: 5px;
}

#tally-inline-popup iframe {
  width: 100%;
  height: 100%;
  border: 0;
  display: block;
  border-radius: 8px;
}

#tally-inline-popup .tip-close {
  position: absolute;
  top: 6px;
  right: 8px;
  width: 32px;
  height: 32px;
  line-height: 28px;
  font-size: 22px;
  text-align: center;
  background: rgba(255,255,255,0.85);
  border: 1px solid rgba(0,0,0,0.06);
  border-radius: 8px;
  cursor: pointer;
}

#main-column a[data-form-url],
#main-column a[data-tally-url] {
  color: #7302D5 !important;
  text-decoration: underline;
  text-underline-offset: 2px;
  text-decoration-thickness: 1.5px;
  font-weight: 600;
}

@media (max-width: 640px) {
  #tally-inline-popup {
    width: min(360px, 94vw);
    height: min(500px, 80vh);
  }
}

#main-column .ab-cta-button a.ab-cta-button {
  background-color: #7302D5;
}

/* Titles in purple */
.ab-link-blocks-wrapper .ab-link-block-item.ab-docs-card-mode .ab-link-block-content-wrap .font-bold {
  color: #7302D5 !important;
}

.ab-tree-navigation-link-active span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
}

</style>

reusableContentVariables.name: string
reusableContentVariables.description: a list or sequence of characters (like letters, numbers, and symbols) used to represent text in a computer programming.

reusableContentVariables.name: Operations
reusableContentVariables.description: An operation is a single module run to process data or check for new data.

reusableContentVariables.name: Credits
reusableContentVariables.description: Credits (formerly operations) are the currency for running scenarios.

reusableContentVariables.name: Route
reusableContentVariables.description: A route is a path that data can flow through in a scenario, visualized as the dotted lines between modules.

rightDoc.name: WhatsApp Notifications and Alerts by SyncMate
